intro: Connarus pubescens, commonly known as the hairy connarus, is a tropical evergreen tree native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its rough, hairy bark and opposite, ovate leaves. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
